bucketList.title: Create a city-wide mycelial network
bucketList.description: Establish a living, underground communication system connecting all of Berkeley's parks and gardens through an intricate web of mushroom mycelium.
bucketList.notes: Remember to consult with the Berkeley Parks Department and local mycological society.

bucketList.title: Attend a Donella Meadows systems thinking retreat
bucketList.description: Immerse myself in advanced systems thinking methodologies at the Donella Meadows Institute.
bucketList.notes: Prepare by re-reading 'Thinking in Systems' and 'Limits to Growth'

bucketList.title: Design a board game based on emergent behavior
bucketList.description: Create a tabletop game that simulates complex adaptive systems, inspired by Conway's Game of Life and ant colony optimization algorithms.

resources.name: The Art of Game Design by Jesse Schell

bucketList.notes: Consider reaching out to local board game cafes for playtesting opportunities.

bucketList.title: Organize a city-wide 'Pattern Language' scavenger hunt
bucketList.description: Create an interactive urban exploration event based on Christopher Alexander's pattern language, encouraging participants to discover and document living patterns in Berkeley's architecture and public spaces.

resources.name: A Pattern Language by Christopher Alexander

bucketList.notes: Collaborate with local architecture students and urban planning department.

bucketList.title: Develop an AI that can generate 'infinite games'
bucketList.description: Create an artificial intelligence system that can continuously generate new game concepts and rules based on James Carse's theory of finite and infinite games.

resources.name: Finite and Infinite Games by James Carse

bucketList.notes: Explore potential collaborations with UC Berkeley's AI research department.

bucketList.title: Host a 'Collaborative Conjuring' TED talk
bucketList.description: Share the principles and practices of 'Collaborative Conjuring' with a wider audience through a TED talk, demonstrating how collective creativity can produce seemingly magical results.

resources.name: TED Talks: The Official TED Guide to Public Speaking by Chris Anderson

bucketList.notes: Practice incorporating actual magic tricks into the presentation.

bucketList.title: Create a 'meta-novelty search' algorithm
bucketList.description: Develop a machine learning algorithm that can perform novelty search on the space of novelty search algorithms themselves, pushing the boundaries of computational creativity.
bucketList.notes: Consider applying for a research grant to fund this project.

bucketList.title: Establish the 'Paracosm Commons'
bucketList.description: Create an online platform for collaborative worldbuilding, governed by principles inspired by Elinor Ostrom's work on managing common-pool resources.

resources.name: Governing the Commons by Elinor Ostrom

bucketList.notes: Reach out to online worldbuilding communities for initial user base and feedback.

bucketList.title: Write a book on 'Algorithmic Origami'
bucketList.description: Compile my experiences and techniques in creating origami based on patterns from agent-based models into a comprehensive guide.

resources.name: Origami Design Secrets by Robert J. Lang

bucketList.notes: Consider reaching out to Robert J. Lang for a foreword.

bucketList.title: Build a Turing machine out of Lego
bucketList.description: Construct a fully functional Turing machine using Lego Mindstorms, capable of performing basic computations.

resources.name: The Annotated Turing by Charles Petzold

bucketList.notes: Consider documenting the build process for a YouTube video.

bucketList.title: Organize a 'Jane Jacobs Walk' in Berkeley
bucketList.description: Lead a community walk inspired by Jane Jacobs' urban theories, exploring the intricate dance of city life in Berkeley's diverse neighborhoods.

resources.name: The Death and Life of Great American Cities by Jane Jacobs

bucketList.notes: Coordinate with local businesses and community centers along the route.

bucketList.title: Develop a 'generative system for generating generative systems'
bucketList.description: Create a meta-level generative system capable of producing novel generative systems across various domains (art, music, architecture, etc.).

resources.name: Proceedings of the Genetic and Evolutionary Computation Conference

bucketList.notes: Explore potential applications in computational creativity and AI art.

bucketList.title: Create a 'Library of Babel' inspired art installation
bucketList.description: Design and build an interactive art installation based on Jorge Luis Borges' 'Library of Babel', using algorithms to generate and display 'all possible books'.

resources.name: The Library of Babel by Jorge Luis Borges

bucketList.notes: Consider collaborating with a local art gallery or the Berkeley Art Museum.
